general_advisory: Dry weather is very likely to prevail over the districts of Odisha during week-1 (7th to 13th February, 2025) with normal to below normal minimum temperatures. In week-2, minimum temperatures are expected to be normal to below normal in certain areas. Farmers are advised to provide irrigation, conduct spraying and intercultural operations during specific periods at suitable times.

advisory: In transplanted rice, apply 35 kg urea per acre as the first top dressing at 20-25 days after transplanting or maximum tillering stage.
Use pheromone traps for monitoring yellow stem borer and leaf folder. When necessary, spray appropriate insecticides.
Apply Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC @ 60 ml/acre in 200 liters of water to control insects.
Use yellow sticky traps to control sucking insect attack at the vegetative stage.
Spray neem oil per liter of water at the initial stage of attack.
Control yellow mosaic virus with suggested insecticides.
Follow similar practices as green gram for pest control and virus management.
Regularly monitor for Mango Hopper attack in orchard.
Avoid irrigation at flowering stage to reduce flower drop.
Manage mango mealy bug with polythene/alkathane sheet and proper pruning.
Treat powdery mildew with wettable sulphur spray.
Use specified insecticides to control pests in tomato, brinjal, and cauliflower.
Monitor for disease infestations like purple blotch in onion.
Avoid chemical application at flowering stages.
Ensure animals have access to clean drinking water in the increased temperature conditions.
Vaccinate animals against common diseases and deworm regularly.
